reviewText:
Black Ops 2 is the most underrated game in the franchise
Blops 2 tried to be different than the previous Call of Doodoos but did it succeed ? Yes!

The Singleplayer
So once again you play as an unstoppable killing machine. What makes this campaign stand out, however, is the fact that your actions and choices actually change the outcome of the game.
There are about 4 different endings. Each triggered by the choices/actions you make and or take.
There's also some little consequences that just scar some of your teammates".

Having different endings in a FPS is a very rare thing. Let alone the fact that the ending depends on the actions you take.
In Deus Ex: Human Revolution your actions didn't matter at all. In the end you just chose between four different endings.
This is not the case in here. In here the ending depends on what you did on the road...making this story more dynamic and even beats some of the RPGs when it comes to affecting the world/story you're in. - Looking at you Mass Effect 3 and Skyrim - No matter what you do in these games
recommended:
both are good games but you have no effect on the world or the story...yet they call themselves RPGs.

Call of Duty: Black Ops II created a good and dynamic campaign that should set a new par to all FPSs but unfortunatelly this little but important aspect of the game is overlooked just because "hurpdurr it's another CoD"...so what ? This CoD tried! Tried and succeeded!

The gameplay itself is your old-known CoD gameplay and we're glad that it's back! Admit it! If CoD would change their gameplay then there would be a lot of angry people out there.
Would you like CS to change the gameplay ? NO! People got angry at DICE when they made character movement more smooth in Battlefield...there's no pleasing people.
The character movement is
hoursPlayed: however
voteText:
a bit smoother than in the previous CoDs and that makes the game a bit more enjoyable. Especially in the multiplayer.

The Multiplayer
I put around 150-160 hours into the multiplayer and I still have nothing to say about it...it's good.
So far i've only enjoyed 3 CoD multiplayers: CoD4
helpfulPercent: MW2 and Blops2.\nSo Blops 2 is in my top 3 Call of Duty games. - This is saying a lot! CoD4 and MW2 are considered the best CoD games even by the hardcore CoD haters!\nThe multiplayer in Blops2 is well balanced
votesHelpful: gives you a lot of freedom (in class creation)
votesTotal: makes it easier to record gameplay footages and is just simple fun.\nThe only issue i have
votesFunny: with the multiplayer
commentsCount:
is that it uses matchmaking instead of having a simple server list.
It's still a very good multiplayer experience and i would recommend it to all kinds of FPS fans!


The game is definitely worth the full price. Only good CoD game on the market that's worth the full price!
+Different choices and endings add replay value to the 8-12h campaign making it a 16-48h campaign.
+Fun and balanced multiplayer that for the first time really lets you play the way YOU prefer.
+Co-op zombie modes
-No server list

You don't need to own any DLCs to fully enjoy this title"

reviewText:
EDIT: I didn't excpect to make this review and make it the most popular review I made, but what ever, its the top of a super popular game over all the other reviews that actually review the game.

First thing is that you are here to see a review for the MULTIPLAYER and not the SINGLEPLAYER, (Campaign) there are way better games for that. The main reason I got this is because I always loved killing people and getting those radical killstreaks. Not for the campaign, but for the multiplayer. If you are here for the campaign, leave, campaign is about 6 hours long, and there is a lot better games for that, like Far Cry 4, got lots of hours in that for singleplayer only game time. If you are here for multiplayer, then get your wallet ready!

Some FAQ:

Q: Do people still play?
A: Yes, at certain times and places. Where I am i can get a game quick from 10am to 10pm (West Coast, USA)

Q: Is it worth full price? ($60)
A: No, I did not get it for full price, why should you. Buy on sale or through trading. (Key Trading bots/people)

Q: Should I use my controler?
A: No, you will cry cause you get 0 kills.

Q: Can I read?
A: Yes.

Q: Are you just making up questions to make this review longer?
A: Yes.

Q: Why?
A: Why not? Plus I can't think of them, so ask away!

Review for each part of the game:

Campaign-
No, get other games, its fun but to short.

Multiplayer-

Better then most other CoDs. MW2 I own, to many hackers. MW2 being a good CoD.
This game is one of the best and still has a strong community of people that make it hacker less.
I also own AW, its bad, and now 0 people are play, #2MuchDLC.
Worth the buy if it was just for this.

Zombies-
Its another fun game, fun by youself and with others!
Different from most zombie games.

Other Pros/Cons

Pros-
-You get 3 games in your Library
-You only have to download the part of the game you want to play, so less space used!
-Not many hackers! Always a good thing


Cons-
-So much paid DLC; a Gun thats super amazinly good, maps that I would like to play, skins. What is this CS:GO? Paying for skins is so CoD, oh wait.
-Less 8 year olds, I like to talk to them, there fun to mess around with
-Sadly no price drop, unlike MW2 and such old games.

So overall well worth the money for the Multiplayer/Zombies!

Original that made me famous:
Still better then Call of Duty: Ghost
Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare and
Call of Duty: Black Ops 3 combined!

reviewText: Still generic CoD gameplay, but better than the other CoDs that run on this engine. The campaign has a great story with 6 endings. I love the choices you get to make. The multiplayer is more balanced than previously. You actually see all kind of weapons used, and not just that one overpowered weapon everybody uses. The zombie mode is also really fun, especially with friends. If oyu haven't played any CoD for some reason and you don't feel like getting an old CoD I recommend you buy this one, and not Modern Warfare 1/2/3. Also, if you're enjoying the Modern Warfare games you could also check it out. It really is an improvement. But as I said, still generic, don't expect too much to change. Oh, also the future style of this game isn't that bad. You will see a drone, but that's all. No lasers and ♥♥♥♥ like some people thought.

reviewText: I have now played all of the Call of Duty titles except for the new Advanced Warfare. Black Ops II is one of my highest rated single player titles in the franchise. The sheer amount of decisions and choices the game allows YOU to make, drastically effect the game world and story. There are I believe 4 different endings in addition to a number of things that can change. I myself recieved the decent but depressing ending. That being said, if you enjoy a game giving you a thrill ride, a good narrative and some solid gameplay choices Black Ops II delivers on all fronts. This may be my favorite Call of Duty game since the first Modern Warfare, it may in fact be better due to the choices and story. If you are a fan of the franchise or enjoy a good solid FPS with a fun, engaging story Call of Duty Black Ops II is for you!\n\n9/0

This CoD, now super old has destroyed the 2 new ones let me just say some good reasons.

reviewText:
Call of Duty®: Black Ops II Multiplayer Total Hours: 2,759
Informal Review
Steam review by Jessica, en / C h x c `

I have played Call of Duty®: Black Ops II for the best part of 3 years and I have been active in each game in the franchise.

This game clearly represents the gaming style of the Call of Duty® franchise. Call Of Duty is an FPS which demands the use of your ears, eyes and mind. You must break situations down and make the correct judgements to execute effective movements. The game allows new people to have killing potential even when more experienced players are in the same lobby. This may be irritating to most but I feel like it gives a more equal tone to even the newest of players.

Gameplay:

Very rarely do you ever experience a lagging lobby unless your ping is 120+. Diamond Camo definitely adds an attractive challenge to the game if you wish to add some style and show off your skills to your opponents/team. Hitboxes are perfect. If you hit them you definitely hit them. I feel like most people think they miss because of the hitboxes, it is simply because the slight weapon sway which may be unnoticeable (this causes the bullet to go into a different direction than they expect). Overall, I feel like nothing in this game is completely outrageous; everything makes sense.

Recommendations:

Sniper Rifles - Ballista/DSR

Assault Rifles - AN-94/FAL-OSW/SCAR-H

Sub Machine Guns - MSMC/MP7/Peacekeeper (Revolution DLC weapon).

Pistols - Five-Seven/Tac-45

Shotguns - R870/KSG

Light Machine Guns - LSAT

Specials - Crossbow/Shield

Launchers - RPG/FHJ-18 AA

Lethal Grenades - Semtex/C4

Tactical Grenades - EMP/Concussion

Attachments - Adjustable Stock/FastMag/Long Barrel/Foregrip/Reflex Sight  (Fast Mag is recommended most for Snipers due to the disadvantage to SMG users and Assault Rifles).

Bugs:

Bug exploitation is definitely a thing. The reload-cancel for the shotgun gives a crazy level of unfair advantage but this is not a part of the game that was intentional, nor was the scroll-wheel pistol spray. These aspects are not often used but scripts for the shotgun and scripts for semi-automatic weapons definitely make things difficult. These aren't things which should be patched but they are definitely exploits to be aware of. I will remind you again that very few people use these.

Overall:

People often ask me why I don't play games such as Battlefield or Counterstrike, the answer is simple.
Call of Duty is the fast FPS. Each game has been developed with a new idea. I have played each game and the only thing that is similar" is the fact that it is a fast FPS.

When people complain about how similar each game is
date: they also manage to complain when the game changes the play-style and movement. You're basically fighting pointless battle when debating with them. Each game managed to bring new models to both people and weapons. They bring new maps
recommended: and often change the physical aspect of these maps too (in terms of graphical type
hoursPlayed: like comparing MW to BO because these games are part different stories
voteText:
they look different). This game is not incredibly demanding in terms of graphics and I can easily reach 200fps with my AMD Radeon HD 7850 on Maximum settings.


This game is excellent if you like fast FPS gameplay and the opportunity to use your own style of movement against people.


Good job

reviewText: You had me there for a minute, Call of Duty: Black Ops 2. I thought you made the complete near-future leap, and thanks to a surprisingly subdued and touching opening cutscene, I even believed you would take the Michael Bay film of video games in a mature, less-is-more direction. Then, for a sizable chunk of the campaign, you dropped me into the 1970s and '80s - a jaunt that included first-person punching Manuel Noriega in his pock-marked face. As gratifying as that was, the cross-decade narrative is disappointing and distracting. While those past portions of the campaign feel like retreading old ground, those that are set in 2025 are the best Call of Duty levels since 2007's Modern Warfare. Why couldn't we have a full game of that?\n\nAt the outset (the year 2025), I was tasked with finding out what Raul Menendez, a populist who presents himself as the savior of the world's poor, is up to. He's deftly set up as a villain with a believable motive, and the US government knows he's planning something. Just one problem: I already knew exactly what that mysterious something was because Activision told us all. I even yelled it at the screen a few times in annoyance: He's planning to take over the US drone fleet
date: you idiots! Didn't you see the commercials?".\n\nThere may not be any surprises left
recommended: but at least it looks good. We're not talking about Battlefield 3-level graphics here
hoursPlayed: but when it's cranked up to the highest settings Black Ops 2 is head and shoulders above anything Call of Duty has done before. Character models
voteText: particularly their faces

votesHelpful: shadow
votesTotal: and water effects are also strong
votesFunny: but when those stellar characters stand next to certain walls or trees
commentsCount: they highlight how low-definition many of the environmental textures are.\n\nThat could have something to do with the fact that the campaign maps are bigger than what I've come to expect from CoD. Just about every one of the 16 missions is set on a relatively open map with various paths
column16: spots to take cover and flank
column17: and pieces of equipment to use to help fend off the enemy. The early Celerium mission
column18: set first in the jungles of Myanmar before descending into a high-tech underground facility
column19: is particularly impressive
column20: with its seamless blend of exterior and interior environments. After years of scripted
column22: it's refreshing and far more interesting than anything we've seen churned out of the CoD factory in years.\n\nThose wider maps are especially fun when Treyarch hands over the keys to future gadgets like the lumbering
column23: Gatling gun- and flamethrower-packing CLAW walker or the swarming
column24: bullet-spewing quadcopter drones. These tools typically aren't the scripted
column25: "get on that machine gun!" moments CoD is famous for
column27: they're wisely integrated elements we can use when and how we decide. The futuristic guns aren't all that remarkable
column28: but some of their sci-fi attachments have a wonderful transforming effect
column29: like the seemingly basic laser dot scope that doubles as an X-ray vision device to spot enemies through walls.\n\nOf course
column30: while these missions are more open than prior CoD maps
column31: it's no Far Cry style open world - they still have artificial limits that rear their ugly heads at the most inopportune times. For example
column32: in a mission where I put the very cool Wing Suit to work by jumping off of a mountain and flying toward my target
column33: I tried to do a bit of exploring and banked to the right. Almost immediately the screen went grey
column34: and I was awarded with instant death for straying "too far from the flight path." On another level set inside a massive resort
column35: I tried to flank the enemy by pushing out to a section of the map I could see on the left. All that stood in my path was a velvet rope
column36: but it might as well have been the Great Wall of China because I wasn't getting past it.\n\nAnother nice touch of limited freedom is a pre-mission menu that allows customization of your loadout
column41: and perk options are all there
column42: giving us real options in how we want to approach each mission. Will I let my squad push forward while I sit back and snipe
column43: or will I surge forward and flank with a submachine gun? It's terrific to actually have the choice of tactics.\n\nThe biggest problem with the campaign is that
column46: fun-to-play stuff is in the near-future setting. The story veers back to the past too often to set up an unnecessary and convoluted human drama that connects protagonist David Mason
column47: his father Alex Mason and buddy Frank Woods from the first Black Ops
column48: and the villain Menendez. I sighed every time I had to flash back to Angola in the 1970s or Panama and Afghanistan in the 1980s to plod through this truly silly tale without all of my cool near-future tools and gear.\n\nAs for the multiplayer : farewell
column49: Kill Streak system. Back when you were young and innovative you helped elevate Call of Duty to juggernaut status
column50: but it's high time you received an upgrade. Surprisingly
column51: it turns out that all that Black Ops 2 needed to make CoD multiplayer feel fresh and reinvigorated
column52: if not reinvented and free of frustration
column53: was a seemingly minor tweak. Meet the Score Streak system
column54: a new well-balanced reward system that makes me feel like an action hero for helping my teammates rather than exclusively celebrating brute-force killing power. Combined with a much more flexible character customization system
column55: Score Streaks help this year's multiplayer feel like more than just another rehash.\n\nAs the name indicates

reviewText:
Picked this up at EB for $28, and in all honesty, I got my moneys worth. Although short, with less than 20 missions in all, I found it quite good and enjoyable. The price steam has it is NOT worth it at all, try and find a physical copy or buy it on console or something, it's probably better to get it on that costwise.

Campaign Mode:
I never played BO1 properly, I played it at a friends house on his ps3, and my experience was very biased, as I had never played a CoD game before, they instructed me to die constantly, killing the experience for me. After playing through BO2's campaign, I have found one of my favourite single player experiences. I enjoyed the storyline, and the characters were great. The bonus(?) levels where you took control of multiple troops was one of my favourite experiences, as it reminded me of some of my favourite games. Like I said, the storyline is rather short, but it is very enjoyable.


Zombies Mode:

After playing Zombies for a bit, I found it quite enjoyable. I found myself playing the doom soundtrack in the background. Zombies mode is your run of the mill horde based zombie defence. Unlock new areas inside your map to make life easier or harder. Fun game mode, and in my opinion, its a good game to play when bored or depressed. It's a good time waster, and the slow moving zombies, tied in with the fact they explode when on fire, is quite funny.

And Finally, Multiplayer:

Multiplayer has to be one of the most fun online FPS experiences I've had since I first started CS:GO or TF2. I've had the same enjoyment that I've had whilst playing games like Doom 1. It started off a little slow and rocky, with everyone else having great weapons compared to my pleb tier weapons. After I hit level 4, I unlocked custom loadouts, letting me use my personal favourite weapon. The multiple game modes make for a fun experience. The only thing I would prefer is a better sever joining system, such as the ones in valve games. BO2's multiplayer server system is more of a wheel of fortune, roll and hope you get a full game.

All in all, Black Ops 2 is one of my favourite games to date, and it is definatley worth a buy if you get it on sale

Well, this is probably going to be one of my longest reviews, so grab a bag of popcorn, some positive vibes, and lets do this.

I'm not going to go into detail on the singleplayer, because I haven't really gotten around to finish it, and I probably wont for another few months.  First, lets talk about about performance.

PERFORMANCE
My PC is an absolute potato. I have a gtx 260 with around 800MBs of VRAM, and an intel i7 920 running at 2.66GHz. However, i still get 60 fps solid in this game with shadows on low in windowed mode around 1300p. I occasionally get a little bit of a framerate drop every once in a while, but it only lasts for half a second or so and then I jump right up to 60 fps again. This game runs extremely well, considering how good it looks.

reviewText:
Call of Duty: Black Ops II is a first-person shooter developed by Treyarch and published by Activision. It is a sequel to the previous game Call of Duty: Black Ops in terms of storyline.

Call of Duty: Black Ops II gameplay are quite interesting, compared with Modern Warfare series, this one does have improvements over the first Call of Duty: World at War and Call of Duty: Black Ops. The single player campaign are not so linear, the story goes on depends on how or what you do. For example you could decide if you want Alex Mason, the series character, dead or alive in the end. There is also new Strike Force mode in the campaign, which the success or failure of these mode will affect the story. Strike Force mode let's you control a squad, a robot and many assets to complete the mission, but if the player dies, then it recorded as loss and will affect how the story campaign goes. The Zombie mode are back also, with more feature and more weapons to use, and more zombies too.

Call of Duty: Black Ops II graphics are still not as advanced as Battlefield, but it'll do. After all, Call of Duty is not about graphics I think. But it's not that bad. The performances are also great, very smooth and making Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 performances like ♥♥♥♥.

Call of Duty: Black Ops is a good sequel, has real improvements to the Call of Duty series, it's worth it. I recommend this.

Rating 8/10

reviewText:
Campaign
When I first looked at the campaign, it seemed kinda boring. But when I finished it, I realised that I was wrong. I would never believe that I will actually say that this Call of Duty has the best campaign. First of all, I like that you can customize your loadout before starting a mission, which is very good because you can play like you want to, without having to pick up weapons from the ground. The story is brilliant, and not to mention that it's a true sequel to Call of Duty: Black Ops. Another thing I like about the story is that you have many choices during the missions, and they will affect your progress and the game's ending. What is truly amazing is that if you fail to do something, you will not be returned to last checkpoint, but it will affect your ending. The missions are very fun, but the only thing I didn't like is the insane amount of cutscenes during missions, and challenges you complete during missions will not be saved until you finish the mission. I was replaying almost all missions to collect the rest intel but none of it was saved because I didn't know this information.

8/10

Multiplayer
After I tried the multiplayer for the first time, I thought it's nothing but a copy of previous multiplayer modes from other Call of Duty games. Maybe it is, but this one has the best weapons, the best maps, and the best scorestreaks. This game may be set in future, but it's not a distant future, so you don't have jetpacks and it doesn't take a long time to kill someone. There are a lot of players playing the multiplayer, so you can easily find a match. I just don't like the community, because most of players say easy" when a match ends. And even worse

reviewText:
If you're looking for perfection in an FPS, look no further. You've found it. SUNDAY! SUNDAY! SUNDAY!

It has action. It has excitement. It has guns. OUTSTANDING!

This is my most played game in my library of 400+ games, every second has been worth it. If you like adrenaline rush gameplay, it's here. If you like boobs, you won't find them here but holy ♥♥♥♥ is the game awesome. It is everything a Hollywood Blockbuster wishes to be, and then some. There is a thrilling, white-knuckle single player campaign that will rack in a whopping 4-5 hours of game time. That's like, an afternoon maybe! It's crazy.

Dice, Chop & Mince In Seconds! You never need to switch blades, chop up vegetables, nuts, & fruits, quickly and easily. With every slap, the finer the food gets and it is easy to clean and the Graty is dishwasher safe. You can't beat that. Now let's break down some features, yeah?

1) A brand new, cutting edge and innovative single player campaign with new characters, new guns and new new.

2) A Cornucopia of multiplayer modes and features. Wanna hop online and shoot people? Check.

3) Now the famous, super-soft fleece blanket that has sleeves comes in super-stylish leopard print! It keeps you cozy, leaves your hands free and won't slip or slide like regular blankets. Machine wash and dry. Imported. 71 x 54".

4) It has more DLC than The Sims franchise. Keep adding onto your experience!

reviewText:
Why bother paying for a gym membership when you can sweat all you want on this game?

Hello guys and girls.
In this installment to the Call of Duty franchise, we go places where no man has gone before. Not to the moon, but to the battlefields of 12 year olds. That's right. This game runs so easily on Intel HD graphics, that anyone can run it! Even you, grandpa!

Treyarch has also released a Rosetta Stone DLC that allows you to learn German in a few games! Wow!

First Infinity Ward gave us the same DLC in the Modern Warfare series to help us learn Russian, and now they're giving us the German DLC? WOW! WHAT A BARGAIN!


In all seriousness, this game is a total sweatfest filled with 12 year olds saying they bagged your mother, and instead of the Russians attempting to prove themselves worthy to Commrade Putin and the Spetsnaz, you've got little Germans who want revenge for the War, and end up unleashing that rage on you instead of doing so in 1944- when they should have.

Basically, if you want to speak fluent German and get rekt ♥♥♥♥♥♥ 1337 MLG Pro" by 12 year olds

reviewText:
Well, Call of Duty Black Ops II was my first Call of Duty on Steam.
Its not easy to review this game because there are many pro and cons, but at the end I decited to give it a thumb up.

Singleplayer
I played the Singleplayercampaign for a few hours and stopped playing it than because of the following reasons:

You should play the campaign of Cod-Black Ops 1 before playing this one because there are some important connections, which help you to understand the campaign much better.
The Grafics are not up to date thinking about a Battlefield 3 and Crysis.
The Story is not really fascinating and there is no variety just thinking about the repetitive gunfights.
The Levels are built linearly
EDIT: I bought Call of Duty Black Ops now and played that campaign as well. Now its much easier to understand this one.

Multiplayer
The focuse of the game is clearly the Multiplayerpart of the game.
I played it now for >23 hours and had tons of fun in there. I like this fast actiongameplay of Call of Duty.
Especially with friends it makes even more fun, if your in the same team or not does not really matter.
I dont know if I am the only one who observed that, but the multiplayermaps like Nukedown and Hijacked were much more beautiful than the locations in the singleplayercampaign.

Fazit
In the end Call of Duty Black Ops II gets a 7/10 from me, but only because of the Multiplayerpart.

I really hope Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare brings us better grafics. Its not the most important thing in games" many people say
date: but if they are soo bad it does not make that much fun."

Status: Get it only if you are interested in zombies
Singleplayer
Has a good story that makes sense with choice making(like in Mass Effect, though they aren't that epic).
They also included a loadout customization before starting each mission, so basically you can pick any weapon and add any attachments. That kind of really freshens up the game.
The game also has strike missions, where you can command your troops in an RTS manner, and take control of anyone. Unfortunately, those were very poorly done. Cause your AI just can't fight the enemy, and you have to do most of the work. Maybe adding the coop would have fixed that, cause the idea is a very unique one, it was just badly executed.
Sadly they still have linear levels, so I don't really suggest you to get it for it's singleplayer

Zombies
They added a new mode - tranzit. There are 5 big locations on this map, and a bus that takes you to them. They also included buildables"

you find parts scattered on the map and you build the item. This mode is a really refreshing experience. A splendid job they did there.

reviewText: Call of Duty 2 is a wonderful team based game. You collaberate with your team to overcome the other teams advanced strategy. In the story mode, you play as Black Op, who's objective is to kill everything in his path, whether it be civillian or enemy, as the game doesn't penalize you for either. Anyways, once you shoot everythin, you are overcome with the fact that  you killed your family . When you realize that, you kill yourself, and then go to hell. In hell, you must combat many baboons who try to rip your skull out. When you complete this, you awaken from your coma, and decide to continue killing all living beings. Eventually, you get tired, so you drink some Mountain Dew and eat some Doritos for strength. This unlocks the multiplayer mode, where you can only spin around and shoot, otherwise people tell you they slept with your mom. This is most likely true, but even so, you have to work together as a team to win the objective. This is quite possibly the best game in existance, and I highly reccomend it.

reviewText:
Call of Duty's first look into the future.

People tend to call Black Ops II the best Call of Duty game ever, and they also tend to say that in a pretty vocal way involving throwing offensive words in the direction of every other Call of Duty title. Well, I personally don't think this is the best game in the series, but it's not the worst one either. Quite far from that.

The campaign feels just like a Treyarch campaign from the very beginning so I'm sure you will like this one if you enjoyed the first Black Ops. Though I also have to say that to me, the story felt very slow and uninteresting for the first few missions and only started getting better and better towards the ending, where it luckily didn't disappoint and lived fully up to the Call of Duty name. Explosions, emotions, action.

Though it's not just your usual Call of Duty campaign. It's very obvious that they have tried to innovate, so apart from the story being separated into the futuristic setting of 2025 and the ending of the Cold War (in a way of flashbacks), there's also a brand new game mode, if that's a proper term for it. It's called Strike Force, seemingly involves more strategy as it's something along the lines of a real-time strategy, and it's a design nightmare and it sucks. There, I said it.

And because that wouldn't be enough to call it innovated, the campaign is pretty complex compared to the previous Call of Duty titles. Why is that? Well, there are multiple paths and endings, and the story actually changes around your actions, to a certain degree. It's not the best thing you'll ever see, but it was a pleasant surprise that the heavily advertised player choices weren't just A or B options in dialogues, but rather something that just happens in the background depending on what you do.

The multiplayer of Call of Duty: Black Ops II feels like a Call of Duty. I mean, yeah, really, what's there to say? There are guns and tons of game modes and scorestreaks and all that good stuff, though to me - apart from the great new system of class creation in which you can pretty much create any combination you desire - it felt like a downgrade from the first Black Ops game. I found it to be based less on skill and more on who knows the wall-banging spots better and can cooperate with their party to abuse the game to death, or your death, and your team's death because boo-hoo you just lost the match.

But yeah, it can be enjoyable, even more so if you play it with a group of friends. Hey, talking friends, I haven't mentioned the Zombies mode yet. It's obviously returning in this title, it has zombies and you shoot them for points and then exchange the points for weapons and the like. And it goes exactly like in every other title with the Zombies mode in - if you like cooperating in shooting zombie heads and have friends who like cooperating in shooting zombie heads, it can be fun.

Black Ops II was an average Call of Duty title to me - I'd pick Modern Warfare 3 over it any day, though.

reviewText:
Greetings and salutations to my many acquaintances. On this day I wish to grant you the privilege of witnessing the product of my musings in regards to this noteworthy piece of interactive entertainment.

Call of Duty: Black Ops II tells the tale of a wayward son who attempts to seek out the fate of his estranged progenitor. Several themes masterfully interlace and course through the story in regards to topics such as: kinship, consequence, and sacrifice; some subtle, and some apparent. This may appear to be rather antediluvian. Rest assured that it is not.

Of course, one must not neglect the defining characteristic of the selected media: Interactivity. Exultantly, I announce that Call of Duty: Black Ops II also excels in this regard. A diverse collection of firearms are available at your leisure and presented in an equipoise manner which the integrity of the plot remain unattenuated.

This impeccable mélange of elements is a true modern genesis. Truly antipodal to mediocrity; a chrysostomatic and puissant apparatus to the blooming intellectual.

reviewText:
So, after reviewing the oh-so-great sequel (that was sarcasm for those who don't get it) I may as well go ahead and review Black Ops 2, also since I directly had some comparisons done with Ghosts. This is mostly on multiplayer.

So yep, Black Ops 2, not just that it is a pretty solid CoD-game with solid mechanics, it's also a pretty good PC-Port. Treyarch sure did a great (maybe even the best) job since the last CoD-game with a proper server browser and freedom (that being CoD4 and World at War - Black Ops 1 was not such a good port performance-wise). It may rely on matchmaking as seen since Modern Warfare 2, but uses dedicated servers instead of player-hosted servers. Also, quite a neat amount of PC-related settings to optimise the game or even give it better-than-consoles graphics and a FOV-Setting!

Also runs at a rock-solid 120+ FPS here (can be set to have a maximum FPS cap of 200 FPS) with no drop-downs below that on max settings, while looking just a tad bit worse than Ghosts - which by itself runs at a varying 45-90 FPS at most times... So yeah, ports-wise it's a great CoD.

Sadly though, the bad taste of Modern Warfare 3 (which was awful, port-wise) probably kept a lot of people from getting Black Ops 2.

Still has a good-enough playerbase now to easily find TDM matches, too.

reviewText:
This Game comes with 3 seperate shortcuts to start, Campaign aka Singleplayer, Multiplayer and Zombies, which is why I will focus on my review on each parts seperatly.

Singleplayer/Campaign:
The Singleplayer is a unique and upgraded experience which is adding to the Story of Black Ops 1. With amazing graphics gorgeous gameplay and lovely music.
This Time there is something new to the CoD Campaign which I never seen before. In some parts of the game, the game gives you the choice. Which means everybody will experience something different but it makes it also replayable to see what you missed out and what would off happened if you would off choosed something else, a little bit like the Tell Tale Games.
Another new thing which was new introduced into the Call of Duty Campaign Series was that before each Mission Starts you can choose your own class almost like you do it in Multiplayer, which makes the game more fun and leaves you more choices.

Multiplayer:
The Multiplayer is one of the best games that got released and is so far one of the last call of dutys that is still playable. The Settings have a native FOV Slider that goes up to 90 and also have Borderless Fullscreen Mode which is for me personally important with 2 screens. There is also a ping filter where you can decide to what kind of people you would like to connect for example would you rather play with 300 ping or with 30? Its up to you. Also this game is one of the only games that has dedicated servers.
There are 5 standard classes already unlocked and with each prestige you can get another one (up to 10 classes). With each Prestige comes also a permanent unlock tocken, which means if you prestige and your favourite weapon is for example going to be unlocked at level 50, you can permanently unlock it right away. Everytime you prestige your guns stay the same level, keep their cammos and attachments unlike Moderen Warfare 3 where you lose everything. Which makes it easier to get gold cammos or diamond cammos.
You can get diamond Cammo which is another first for the Call of Duty Series, if you want to get diamond guns you have to go through all the challenges for one class for example the smgs, once you got all gold, the diamond cammo will be unlocked. Those Challenges are alot of fun to do. So if you ever get bored of just brainlessly killing people or you like games where you can work towards something than you should try this out.

Zombies:
The Zombie Mode comes by default with 1 Map the Bus Depot you can buy more maps by purchasing the DLC or the Season Pass. The Zombie Mode itself is fair and has good graphics, sometimes it can be a bit glitchy but 99,9% of the time you won't find anything wrong with it. The Graphics are amazing and there is as well as in Number 1 always a hidden Song. You can complete the Bus Depot Map on your own or together with a friend (I recommend 2 people). The Story is really facinating and I hope it is going to continue in Number 3.
But you do not have to play the Story on Zombies, you also can play turned, where you fight as a zombie against your friends and Survival where you are just in one spot and can see how many rounds you will make it until the zombies finally got you.

For Achievement Hunters:
The Singleplayer should be easy to complete.
The Multiplayer is also easy to complete as long as you have a good team to play in the League Mode.
The Zombie Mode will require alot of work and is rather hard to do. Mostly you won't be able to do it on your own, so for some maps you will need up to 4 people with good communication possibilitys.

All in all, this game is wonderful. Yes I know there is a few cheaters in the multiplayer, but unlike other games you can record or even make pictures and send your proof + steam id of the cheater, to the actuall developers and they will ban the cheater.
See also my Guide:  Guide for how to report a Cheater

Due to the fact that this is one of the only games that have dedicated servers and Developers that still banning people it is playable and can be still alot of fun. Another important thing I forgot to say is, that it is very well optimised and I had no problems running it whatsoever on max graphics. It also supports 120fps screens. Personally this is my favourite Call of Duty so far.

reviewText:
Well, as a start I'd like to say that I didn't want to play this game for a fairly long time, I bought a deluxe edition in June 2013 (It had belt buckle, OST disc and Nukecity DLC). I installed it only around November of the following year and got to actually play it somewhat in beginning of May.
And, yes, I underestimated it.
The game itself looks better than its ancestors in fact, it is clearly seen at points, faces show expressions and the characters don't look like robots...The graphics did become better as well, comparing to MW3, it's made a decent leap. Everything, looks better, somewhat like Mirror's Edge especially to the end of the game when things start exploding (YEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEAH).
The story is divided into three parts. Let me tell about every of them in short:

First story:
As usual, flashbacks of Woods, who did survive in Laos (or it was Vietnam?..) Anyway, this looks pretty interesting, has some stupid moments, some ridiculous twists, but to be honest, I liked this part the most. It ends at somewhat middle of entire game

Second story:
The main part, protagonist of which is son of Alex Mason, who follows old foe of his father and so on and so forth. This part takes place in 2025. it has some futuristic features, but all in all, the gameplay is pretty sample to first. I didn't like this one too much, even though it has a pretty charismatic character named Harper, and that it has the most conscious plot...The thing is that this part looks a lot like Crysis because of those future weapons and stuff. I know, that it hardly would look any different, if you want to make some close-future shooter, but still.

Third story:
Is kinda the ♥♥♥♥♥iest for me. You command a squad that goes all around the world, defending different places from the main villain's troops. It's made as a tactical part of game, you have around 10 soldiers and machines under your control and you can control every of them on your own, but as tactics it's pretty useless...Choose all your troops and command to attack enemy, not a big deal. I finished it as well, so there.

The thing I did like about the game is the variety of endings. The thing is that the only two things you're going to care for are Woods and Harper, so that doesn't matter way much, but in game it is pretty exciting, to choose things, knowing it may affect the game

Sound is good, I really liked the ending, even though not fan of A7X, but yeah, pretty cool

I hardly played multiplayer, but it looks pretty fun too, a lot like MW2 which I did like

In the end, would I recommend this game? Yes, if you're afraid to waste your time on one more CoD ♥♥♥♥♥♥ shooter omg"

reviewText:
For the single player:

You will shoot ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s of ppl. No idea if they are good or bad. SHOOT EM!
Also ... you are on a horse. Which makes the singleplayer badass.


For the zombies:

They are cute. The maps are really nice and you can do lots of things on them, building stuff, set yourself up. If the rest of your team is not playing the game with their nose or randomly insulting and trolling around. So ahhm... nope you can't. Sorry.
But the game basicly offers it which is positive. Right? RIGHT!


THE MULTIPLAYER!

Never played any CoD, was allways more of a battlefield guy ... I guess. Well friends kept asking. So I checked out which one could be best opt for PC. Seems to be this one.

So for the game. Ahm o_0
You spawn, you shoot at massive big gigantic insane awesome random MOTHER OF GAWD ........... hitboxes. No srsly... the hitboxes are like an aura. I like auras. Who not? Seen freakingh star wars 1000 times.

You'll find cute creatures next to you, doin' 360 720 s switching weapons. And shooting a bullet across the map for whatever reason while the enemy is calling in streak after streak and bringing uup freaking Lord of the dance stoppin you into particles. You know... these lil tiny nuclear once... at least that would explain why ppl keep mention ZOMFG nuCLEAR \o/

Sometimes you will find yourself in a gamemode which is kinda objective based. Like ahm ... flags waving and you can take those points. Or dogtags you cooooooooooouuld pick up. But mostly you will find yourself getting some Lord of the Dance streak as soon you reach those points. So nvm that.

So for gunhandling. Ah ye. Allways bunnyhop, then throw yourself prone. First time I've seen that... I was like the fug is that dude dancing??!?!? o_0... yep lost of dancing here.
No worries abouut any weapon sway or aiming off or and spread increasing while you are hip hop hup haddehhup wabbiting around. THERE IS NON!

The whole movement works pretty good, hitreg is working, yoou need to let em that. And i guess thats why it sells so darn good. Right? DICE?! YES I AM ASKING YOU!!!!!!!

Then there are these full prestiged (ranked out) I don't even need a weapon to kill ya bro ppl. So. Just ignore that. If they kill you, it will happen out of nowhere, you won't get a clue how and why. Just accept it. WON'T YOU ASK! They can! Yo not! Simple!

Ah ye. Turn off the VOIP and chatbox. Treat them like bots. I've turned it on, and seen some of the fines bottom line insulting ever.

You can also check other steam profiles. You don't wanna do that either. Every 2. - 3. check you will see a VAC ban on a profile. No idea if that is supposed to be psychological warfare. But it really is like that.


So ahm.
Ye great game.
If you don't go tryhard mode all the way. The hitreg is working, The movement and the controls working pretty good.
Very rare that you'll get a disconnection. I think happent to me 2 or 3 times. So thats all fine.

And the really good stuff ... and ye I mean GOOD!
Lobby joining :D I mean come on. ded servers are so 2010. Lobbies are the thang! It will basicly do one thing or another for you. Depending on what type of player you are.
1. choice:
You can relax, get some coffee, maybe cook some dinner, spend a bit of youur time with your family. You know... those ppl you see in the kitchen now and then. Introduce yourself to them. They'll be suprised.
2. choice:
It will turn youu pi**sh** insane and you will end up beeing the one playing this game with your nose and random insulting ppl all over the place.
YES! Lobbies can do that.


Now get black ops 2. Its a freaking good game! Oh and the cyborg customisation DLC. Cuz its glowing on your gun! GLOWING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!


Heff FUN! git GUD!

reviewText:
The Campaign: Call of Duty - Blalck Ops 2 feature a hudge verioty not only in the missions itself but in the oputunitys of the stoyline, guns, camos, reticles and ect. The Black Ops 2 campaign isn't great but it is good for a military shooter it features a hudge charecter set and the story line based on all of America's US millertary drones turning on the US and wiping out major populations and cities it has a back story and a futeristic look and playthough as you complete this awesome campaign. Inbetween missions you have combats stats and are able to unlock more things as you got, combat stats are mainly earned by completing missions and mainly missions like the S.P.E.C misions which is where you have to fight in places such as india, pakistan and china trying to gain controll over the areas it earns you more unlocks as well as combat stats inproving so you're able to unlock more and more.

Multiplayer: Multiplayer is key focused on objectives such as CTF, TDM, KC, Domination, and Demolition, ect. It helps your clan/sqaud play through and improve and rank up it is on of the most awesome multiplayers featured in the treyrch series and is definitly every cent worthy. Hardcore is anoth list of modes where you can't use radar all the time, you can only use your eyes and stratigic skills, it is mainly for people who have had alot of experince and think they're up for it.
-Party Games are another great playlist featuring game modes such as Sticks and Stones: A gamemode using only balistic knives (Knives witch are able to shoot rods/ one shot kill), Crossbow (Rods once you shoot blow up your enimie like a lethel semtex granade), and finally the combat axe that alows you to through your axe up to phanomanal distances to kill and enimay.

And Finally ZOMBIES! - Zombies mode feature four players maximuim the players are fighting (you guessed it) blood thirsty zombies who will stop at nothing to kill you and your team mates, the maps are always diffrent in previous times but are simular in most aspects, but on Black Ops 2 if you didn't buy dlcs you start on a mode called tranzit and every map in tranzit  is free to play singly without having to play tranzit/ tranzit is recomended by almost everyone who plays it reason being it's a fun and addictive game mode with features you and your friend riding in a bus stop at unknown locations such at the bus depo (Spawn) the Dinner (first place fore the mistory box) (misterory box moves around the map just like in every other treyarc mode execped for World at War's nazi zombies) The farm: a location for the hatch for the bus (sometimes) and the crop field power station a white place beneth the building (unknown so far) where your able to turn th epower on to achive drinks such as Juggernod, spped cola, ect. And every 5 rounds a power monster comes to kill you who's only weekneace is by going back and turning th epower off and back on.


DLC's: I myself have all 4 dlc's five if you include zombie nuketown and i have experinced every weapon ther eis I can say so far that every aspect of Black Ops 2 zombies is a fun/ horrorfing blood goring experince witch is worth the money and the dlcs feature four maps witch I wont go into detail all i can say is I like all of the in atleast one way minimuim and are worth it.

reviewText:
Call of Duty: Black Ops II is a first-person shooter developed by Treyarch and published by Activision. It is a sequel to the previous game Call of Duty: Black Ops in terms of storyline.

Call of Duty: Black Ops II gameplay are quite interesting, compared with Modern Warfare series, this one does have improvements over the first Call of Duty: World at War and Call of Duty: Black Ops. The single player campaign are not so linear, the story goes on depends on how or what you do. For example you could decide if you want Alex Mason, the series character, dead or alive in the end. There is also new Strike Force mode in the campaign, which the success or failure of these mode will affect the story. Strike Force mode let's you control a squad, a robot and many assets to complete the mission, but if the player dies, then it recorded as loss and will affect how the story campaign goes. The Zombie mode are back also, with more feature and more weapons to use, and more zombies too.

Call of Duty: Black Ops II graphics are still not as advanced as Battlefield, but it'll do. After all, Call of Duty is not about graphics I think. But it's not that bad. The performances are also great, very smooth and making Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 performances like ♥♥♥♥.

Call of Duty: Black Ops is a good sequel, has real improvements to the Call of Duty series, it's worth it. I recommend this.

reviewText:
I bought this in the Activision publisher sale weekend as I wanted to play the campaign. From reading the other reviews, I'm not interested in the multiplayer aspect as it seems it is full of hackers and cheats which to me doesn't make a good experience. I can never understand why people would want to cheat in the first place. It doesn't make it enjoyable for the hackers and cheats or anyone else.

Anyway, onto my experience of the campaign. The word I would use to sum up my experience is frustrating. The story, graphics and shooting are all amazing. Thats the good news. The problem is that the game constantly crashes. In my two hours of playtime, the game must have crashed about forty times. Each time it crashes, the only way I can rectify it is to log out of windows, log back in and start again. From such a big publisher making so much money I find this kind of thing totally unacceptable.

I'm pretty new to pc gaming but in my experience many games from big publishers seem to have many problems. Having to constantly jump through hoops just to do simple things like change the resolution in a game, sometimes spending hours looking at forums but not finding a fix is not my idea of fun. It makes me just want to dust off my PS4 and play a game that I know will work straight away.

At present, I have deleted the game and I'm currently reinstalling it to give it another go. If it still doesn't work then I've just wasted just over £13 on something that doesn't work properly. It could be good but I can't recommend it.

reviewText:
Call of Duty Black Ops 2 is my favourite Call of Duty game. It is set in near future, showing us weapons that will be important in modern day warfare.
Single player was nice. The game have more different endings. You can also edit your loadout before starting the mission, which is nice innovation and improvent that BO2 is offering us.

Lets go to multiplayer. I played almost every CoD out there and BO2 is definetly my favourite one. If you want to buy great game to play with your friends, than Bo2 is must buy game.
Awesome emblem editor, theatre mode, great scorestreak and nice perk system is making this my favourite CoD game. Multiplayer is playable without any major lag. You have a lot of different camos, that are making game even more interesting and fun.

Lets go to zombies now. You have one standard map,called Tranzit. Personally,i do not like it too much. If you want true zombie experience you need to try dlc maps.

Bo2 is game that really ruined my social life. I played 1100+ hours of multiplayer and I still have feeling that i did not try half of things in game. This is must have game for every multiplayer and first person shooter fan.

10/10

Uh...
I don't know what to write here..
So i'm just going to give you the recipe for making waffles.


Ingredients:
2 eggs
2 cups of all-purpose flour
1 3/4 cups of milk
1/2 cup of vegetable oil
1 tablespoon of white sugar
4 teaspoons of baking powder
1/4 teaspoon of salt
1/2 teaspoon of vanilla extract



Steps:
1.Preheat waffle iron. Beat eggs in large bowl with hand beater until fluffy. Beat in flour, milk, vegetable oil, sugar, baking powder, salt and vanilla, just until smooth.

2.Spray preheated waffle iron with non-stick cooking spray. Pour mix onto hot waffle iron. Cook until golden brown. Serve hot.


12/10 - Would make waffles again.

reviewText:
pros:
+ Campaign story (8.0/10), Campaign gameplay (8.5/10)
+ Zombies gameplay (9.5/10)
+ Multiplayer (8.5/10) before the patch (3-4 months after release) and 'COD-bots'

cons:
- requires low latency, high speed internet connection - otherwise a permanent 1-2s delay
- requires near state of the art equipment (of the release date) - otherwise bottleneck lags
- map spawns:
enemies often spawn just behind the player, high spawn trapping possibilities on some maps
- very small maps:
prefers blind rushing tactics mostly with one of numerous fast killing weapons
- repetitive map scenarios:
except for two biggest's maps of the base game there are very few optimal paths to play;
potential placement of traps, ambushes, snipers after some time will become obvious
of course there are people who are trying to be original but not all achieve positive results
- match making: being force joining into mid-matchs or constant migration between lobbies
- COD-bots (underage; mostly cheating; unable to get high scoures in more demanding FPS;
often talking about skill, swag, asking if are 'u mad', sometimes having intimate relations with my mother)
- game style:
spray or die; knife runners
- game mechanics:
smg-like sniper rifle mobility; jumps or going prone without affecting aim, mostly recoilless weapons

sum up:
buy it for the Campaign and Zombies, also try the Multiplayer but I advice You to leave it alone

reviewText:
A few years ago in the town of Middlebury Oregon, there was a man named Joseph Woodstock. He liked to be called Joey. He was a nice fellow, with a few close friends. The local ladies who saw him sometimes bowling at the local Bowl-o-Rama Bowling Alley said he was pleasant on the eyes. He was a nice guy to be around, and a very pleasant conversationalist. He knew all the right things to say, and never seemed to be on anyone's bad side. He never had a run in the with local police, and was very straight and narrow. He owned an auto parts store in town. the shop being one of only 2 auto places in town was profitable, leaving Joey to skip the 9 to 5 grind, and have plenty of free time to pursue more leisurly activities. Joey was American as apple pie, and loving life to the fullest. He did have a girlfriend, whom he had even asked to marry him recently. She gladly accepted. Joey's life seemed set.

Joey was a good wholesome average man, with lots to live for. Which is why none of the rest of this makes sense...

On the night of September 14th, 2012, Joey was last seen sitting outside of his 2 story home, on his steps. A neighbor recalls seeing Joey through her window across the street. Joey appeared to be shaking, wearing only what appeared to be a towel, shorts (possibly boxers), and no shoes on. He looked a mess. The neighbor went downstairs, and when she went out of her door to see if Joey was okay, he was gone. She went to his front door and rang the doorbell, but there was no answer.

2 days later, Joey's body was found outside of town washed up in a riverbed.

Police say there was no signs of foul play, and it appeared that he had commited suicide by jumping off a bridge located further upstream, breaking his neck on impact. None of this made sense. This man, whom was recently engaged and not in any trouble financially or otherwise, took his own life? This made no sense at all.

Police searched his home and found no evidence of foul play. When they searched his den, the lights were flickering off and on, with a faint humming coming from a computer fan. The computer had been left on. Maybe there were clues here? One officer walked up to the computer desk, and touched the mouse enough to get the computer out of sleep mode. what he saw haunted him. A few seconds later, the computer monitor sparked, and then it shut off. It had died. As well as the computer with it.

Haunted by what he had seen, officer Henry King mentioned none of this to other officers, and left what he had seen on the screen out of his report.

4 days later, Henry King was found dead in his apartment. He had hung himself the night before.

On his computer monitor it flickered off and on. Call of Duty®: Black Ops II. Scribbled on a notepad also on his desk, in almost illegible hand writing was a small message: Abandon all hope ye who enter here""

reviewText:
Reviews for the Deaf and Hard of Hearing
---

With regard to accessibility for deaf/hoh gamers, I give Black Ops 2 8/10 single player and 6/10 multiplayer.

Gameplay
I am an avid FPS gamer.  Like any FPS, you will get killed by things you did not know were coming.  Even the most well-captioned FPS game will have uncaptioned audio cues for imminent danger.  That said, Black Ops 2 does okay in this category, but doesn't break the mold.

Subtitles/Text
Subtitles for single player are just subtitles - no captions - but they help tell the story.  I do feel that they are a little slow, though, for key moments when you have to react quickly.  For multiplayer, there are no captions or subtitles.  You are on your own.

Chatting/Communicating
BO2 allows text chat, but most players make use of voice chat in my experience.  In the lobby, you can ONLY use voice chat - there is no input for text there.

reviewText:
I enjoyed this game. But I put thumbs down because it has bad optimization.

My PC spec is

CPU : i7-4790

GPU : NVidia Geforce GTX 750

RAM : 8GB

Hard : 1TB

Motherboard : B85

PSU : Corsair 500W Bronze

I get average 90 ~ 100 fps rate during this game.

Of course I put one of the highest game settings.

It just keeps crashes during the game.

I don't care about fancy guns or vehicles. I just want good optimizations.

But I like the guns so I put for thumbs up.

As so far to me, I experienced COD : Ghosts and Black OPS II had bad optimizations.

reviewText:
W.I.P Review - (Work In Progress)

Firstly since Black Ops 2 comes as 3 separate games on your Steam Games List when you buy it (Black Ops 2 - Campaign, Black Ops 2 Multiplayer & Black Ops 2 Zombies) i will be reviewing them all here split into thier own sections to make it easier to see which part of the game i will be reviewing.

Black Ops 2 - Campaign

The campaign to this game is really good in my opinion, i have thoroughly enjoyed pretty much every mission.  The story line is not too bad and links in with previous story lines from Treyarcs CoD games.  The graphics i run at maximun are not too bad either but there are parts of various missions in which there are most certainly texture issues or misplaced objects which you can see in my steam screenshots for this game.

The campaign is as with every other CoD just as explosive and violent with so much variety in the scenery or vehicles you can use etc.  One thing i do like in this campaign is being able to use an Access Kit during every mission, which allows access to various perks such as Drones, ASD's or CLAW's (Military Automated Units) and also things like Flak Jackets for reduced explosive damage and alternative Melee weapons.  Some parts are as with previous CoD's overly excessive with violence but it doesnt make the game any less fun in my opinion.

Also as with many previous CoD games there are Intel's to collect in each mission, however something i liked in this game is that there are two versions of Intel - One for missions based in the Past, and one version for the missions based in the Future. There are also Challenges for each mission which if completed allow access to more perks and more powerful weapons to use in the missions ahead or previous missions if you use the Replay Mission feature (after completing story).

The last feature i do like in this game was the ability to choose your weapons setup before starting a mission. You are able to choose both a primary and secondary weapon of your choosing with up to 3 attachments too.  Then you can also choose your grenades and perks too. Some grenades, weapons or perks are required to do the challenges in the game but sometimes those particular missions would also have the required weapon laying around nearby. Also challenges are not necessary to complete so its not super important if you dont take any particular weapon, grenade or perk.

Achievements - Achievements are also separate for each part of this game, the Achievements for the campaign part are all pretty straightforward, the most difficult being to complete every single challenge in every single mission including the StrikeForce missions.

Cons

The bad points i have picked up on having played this game are as follows:

- Lag

For some unknown reason at some point in pretty much every single mission i had huge lag spikes where my FPS (Frames Per Second) would drop to like 2 FPS.  I have an absoloute beast of a computer and could run max graphics 100% of the time with no issues but these random lag spikes hit for like upto around 15 seconds where i can barely turn or anything because its going so slow.  Its not based on internet in this case as its purely singleplayer even if you disconnect internet and play its the same issue.  Fortunately this only happens about once on every map for no more than 15 seconds and may have not happened at all some times.  The only reason i say every mission is because i have played through each mission multiple times to get every challenge complete for the achievements.

- Cinematics

This game has ALOT of cinematics, and they are very good and work well alongside the missions and quite often during the missions.  Therefore i have absoloutly no issue with the cinematics at all and this should not put the average player off at all.  However, if you are attempting to do EVERY SINGLE CHALLENGE in order to get EVERY SINGLE ACHIEVEMENT, you have to play through each mission multiple times and it takes a very long time watching the cinematics over and over again.  Some you can skip fairly quickly, sometimes you have to watch for like 30 seconds before it can be skipped and you can start the mission.  But the in-game cinematics 9 times out of 10 cant be skipped and takes forever to just continue with the mission to get your challenges or whatever.

Would be very nice to just have instantly skippable cinematics when using the Replay Mission feature after having completed the story at least once. Watching the same cinematic however many times it takes you to do some of the challenges is just not fun :P

- A.I. / StrikeForce Challenges

The A.I. (Artificial Intelligence) units for this game are not too bad for the main campaign, you probably wont have a problem with them. However the A.I. in the StrikeForce Missions are absoloutly terrible and make them almost unplayable. I have completed all 5 StrikeForce missions in the Tactical View only for the Challenge required for the Achievement, and occasionally the A.I. just dont move ever, they get stuck and they stand until they die.  Having said that, the StrikeForce missions i have done in Tactical View were pretty straightforward and i did the challenge first time.

The mission 'Shpwrecked' even on Recruit difficulty seems to be impossible to do due to A.I. not doing anything at all, or dying almost instantly to enemy soldiers or ASD's. They don't attack enemies en route to waypoints, they just run straight past them, so they die.  You do seem to have to really work to get them to kill things and defend properly in this one mission.

I have completed this mission with very little difficulty having finally gotten around to it, at the time i completed it, i had quite a large force of soldiers, ASD's and a claw all fairly close to each other so they seemed to protect each other from dying so easily.  Once the Tactical View Challenge is done for all StrikeForce missions the rest of the challenges are a breeze.

One thing i will note to help others in completing challenges is that you do NOT need to successfully complete the mission so you can spend as long as you like 'running over soldiers with an ASD' for example until time runs out and you fail the mission if thats what it takes.



Black Ops 2 - Multiplayer

Haven't really played this enough to review just yet - W.I.P

Achievements - There are only 5 achievements for this part of the game, they appear to be very straightforward and one should not have a problem getting all of the achievements with probably less than 30 hours played. Assuming you physically try to get them as you do have to play in certain playlists to get 3 of them.  The other two being reach level 10 and reaching Prestige for the 1st time.



Black Ops 2 - Zombies

Haven't really played this enough to review just yet - W.I.P

Achievements - The Achievements for this part of the game if you want all of them DO REQUIRE ALL DLC, otherwise you can only get about 1/4 of them. I personally have not really played the zombies mode much but having being part of the zombies community and having seen alot of Livestreams of these base maps and DLC maps i would probably recommend the DLC if you enjoy the zombies mode.

reviewText:
There are some serious flaws with this game.

First of which is that the campaign is boring. I never cared about a Call of Duty storyline since the second Modern Warfare and this one does not stand out.

Secondly, the multiplayer is incredibly annoying, and if you are relatively good with shooters, that doesn't matter. I can (when i'm not hungover or stressed out) get top of the team in games like Counter-Strike, Battlefield, and even Day of Defeat, games that are considered more difficult than Black Ops 2. Skill from other games does not carry over to this one. The playing field is so leveled that you could call it a bottomless pit. Hell, someone with no experience concerning shooters can (after getting familiar with the ebb and flow of the controls and overall structure of the game) demolish people who actually have skill. With the utterly ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ decision to include things like target finders, select fire, etc. anyone can pick this game up and do relatively good.

Finally, zombies. Yes it is a unique" gamemode. Yes I enjoy it. That doesn't mean you can say it fantastic or better than games like Left 4 Dead or Killing Floor; games that are head and shoulder over this overly repetive

reviewText: This game is terrible. The storyline's been done to death, and the only real objective here is shoot the people who don't have an American accent. I friendly fired more times than I could count, only because the damn game decided to show me their names AFTER I started firing. Not only that, but they didn't even have the decency to reprimand me for doing it!! Your character handles like a cardboard box in a gust of wind, and you're the wind. It made me carsick, which I have never felt before now. The graphics are also terrible. EVERYTHING IS F*CKING SHINY!! SKIN IS SHINY, RADIOES ARE SHINY. THE ONLY THING I FOUND THAT WASN'T SHINY IN THE ENTIRE CAMPAIGN WAS A SINGLE CLOTH MAP! Not to mention the weapons! They're either OP, or unable to hurt a fly depending on who holds them! A SMAW like weapon somehow could one-shot a tank, but when the enemy was handling them, it took two body shots, two body shots from the same thing to kill me. If being unrealistic was a crime, or even just being inconsistent, this game would have the death sentence. Ultimately, this game is flat out bad and boring. It brings nothing unique or interesting to the table, and you'd be better off playing war with tiny figurines.

reviewText:
I got the game on Steam Sales, believe me, if the price didn't drop I don't think I'd ever even think of buying it, and I suggest you shouldn't too.
Now, about the game.
It's very fun, Call of Duty is not meant to be taken seriously, it's a game you just go in and kill other people, just for the fun of it, at least that's what kind of experience I gain from it when I play. *Note this part was meant to talk about online.*
Now, for the single player part.
I'd suggest you try the other COD games as well, perhaps playing and finishing the original Black Ops will give you a bit of a more clear view of what's going on.
It has some very epic moments, like, for example, a HUGE fight with machetes and guns and limbs falling around (Yes, the game has gore in the campaign too if you'd like to know, even though it's single player ONLY (and zombies mode))
Now, if you're thinking of buying Black Ops 2, the game comes with the zombie mode for free, so let's also talk about that.
Zombie mode is a very old feature which I believe started from COD 4 or WaW, which many people loved, and still do, in case you are not familiar with it.
It's a very fun mode to play with friends, and it's the only way not to get bored of it. It includes only 3-4 maps originally, while the rest of them are DLCs, even though those 3-4 are pretty damn big, especially the bus one!! :P
As I said, zombies are dismemberable and also feature lots of gore, but as the rounds increase, zombies get tougher, and tougher, until it's just impossible to hold back.
Hope you found my review helpful, perhaps I didn't add lots of details, but feel free to ask me any questions by PMing me.
voteText: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful

Now, if you're thinking of buying Black Ops 2, the game comes with the zombie mode for free, so let's also talk about that.
Zombie mode is a very old feature which I believe started from COD 4 or WaW, which many people loved, and still do, in case you are not familiar with it.
It's a very fun mode to play with friends, and it's the only way not to get bored of it. It includes only 3-4 maps originally, while the rest of them are DLCs, even though those 3-4 are pretty damn big, especially the bus one!! :P
As I said, zombies are dismemberable and also feature lots of gore, but as the rounds increase, zombies get tougher, and tougher, until it's just impossible to hold back.
Hope you found my review helpful, perhaps I didn't add lots of details, but feel free to ask me any questions by PMing me.

reviewText:
Black ops 2
Sadly must say that i just bought this game for the zombie mode hehe :D But played multi aswell and can say for myself its a taste thing.Old games like bo1,mw3 and whatever...classic generation.Im a old guns and war games loving shooter player.Bo2 was the beginning of moving the cod generations into the future and yea.Not my thing but it is a great game of course.Maps are big,many colours >w< ! graphic improvement is also there.Its playable for a long time.The zombie mode for me also was a cool thing.Dark and scary maps,much fire,the story keeps going on where the moon from bo1 got destroyed.It is well made for me.And this game also supports ranking games in multi and zombies for each skill level.Love the idea and it will get better like this keep the good work up.

reviewText:
This is an honest review of Call of Duty: Black Ops 2

I believe that this is one of the best Call of Duty games that they have produced. What makes me say this is that all three branches of the game were very good in quality. The Campaign didn't feel rushed at all and had a great story to it that I couldn't stop playing. The Multiplayer felt really nice, faster paced gameplay and mostly balanced weapons made this game really enjoyable. The Zombies had the most maps of any Call of Duty game that I have ever seen, it was tons of fun slaying the undead in this game,

PROS:
-Balanced multiplayer (Mostly)
-Good zombies mode
-Excellent campaign
-Good map design
-Search and Destroy
-Emblem editor
-Veiwable combat record
-SO MANY CALLING CARDS
-Ranked playlist
-Nukejacked playlist (18 players at a time on a really small map)

CONS:
-Hackers (this game has a few known hackers but most days it isn't an issue)
-Low fan base. I wish more people played this game :(
-Hunter killer drones (They kill you through buildings sometimes)


FINAL VERDICT:
Overall, this game is great. I've spent over 500 hours (even though it says I've only spent 9.3 hours) having fun pwning noobs. I would recommend this game to anybody who doesn't hate Call of Duty just because it's Call of Duty, this game is what got me back into Call of Duty after MW3.

SCORE: 9.4/10

I loved COD 4, COD WaW and BO3 looks alright, but this game is just... well... let's just say it MADE a stereotype for shooters.

reviewText:
*MULTIPLAYER*
Every map is a copy of the map hijacked just with different stuff. In other words its 3 laned for every map and it creates no diversity from game to game. I have enough hours on this game to say that there are no unique memorable nights of this game of playing the objective, but only for lame trickshots and trollers. All of this is how it is because the maps are all the same so you tell the same people to do the same thing every time the game starts and it makes nothing different. It bothers me how people complain about camping in this when it is hard to do. I've counted and found 1 or 2 rooms in the whole multiplayer map base where there were only 1 entrance to the building. There's always a way around and a flank to it. There are no hidden ledges or any secret spots to visit, all tables and chairs are blocked off and you can't even jump on top of them. Purely locked down.

*SINGLE PLAYER*
I personally admired the story portion where you go back in time to black ops 1 viet nam era to get woods. I like that factor of it but the modern age was just kinda dissapointing and I don't know how to put that into words.

*ZOMBIES*
The characters for zombies for the first few maps that replaced the old group made my cringe level rise higher then americas debt. On a soccer mom scale, I don't even find the characters satisfying. The whole tranzit bus story thing bothered me because I thought there was more to it. I got more rage from flying monkeys on me then fun slaying zombies. Die Rise the map focused on a skyscraper was buggy and was too confusing, the zombies maps have become too much of a single mission to get to one place versus surviving. They improved upon this with Alcatraz, this map didn't disapoint me, but didn't satisfy me. The ability to die and have a chance to revive yourself is basically a big F*** you to the survival aspect and creates anger for me personally. Buried was a little better, it had more of the black ops 1 stay in one area and camp feeling and it was way less confusing to get to know. The hidden song and the whole map itself I really enjoyed playing and some nostaliga of it was generated. The final created map was great, Origins. It brought back the old group back in the earlier times which I really enjoyed, the open world of this map was a pure plus in my opinion, It succeded at having a plot and a goal to it but not confusing the hell out many people. The goals in this map did not have to be succeded to have fun and play, and many avaliable spots for training. They also made me get reminded of the world at war feeling.


6/10 Wouldn't hijacked again.

reviewText: One of the best campaigns i've played in a long time out of the Call of Duty series. One of the best Cods released in a long time. The only down side about this game is that it's pricey but it's an amazing game. The Single Player has an amazing story line as well as different choices for replay value. You also get to customize what your character uses in the single player mode. The Multiplayer has been one of the best since Cod 4 and has guns from all our favourite past CODs and have nerfed some guns to make them more balanced although i have not played that much multiplayer this is due to the fact of playing countless hours on the other CODs and i'm just bored of playing it's Multiplayer. With a high price tag many people may not get this but you can find the game cheaper else where and the dlc bundle on sale for $35. This is one of the most expensive games i've owned but i think it's worth the money. The game is more fun to get with friends. It's such a shame that Cod games have to be so expensive if they were slightly chepaer they could make more money. With the default prices being $90 for the base game, $70 for the dlc bundle the game is rather pricey and $110 for the digital deluxe edition which unlocks you the soundtrack, nuketown zombies map and a copy of call of duty world at war the game is still rather expensive. They should make the game $100 with all DLC or something even then it's still really pricey. But the game can be bought chepaer outside of steam but there's no way around to paying $70 for the season pass unless it's on sale. The zombies is by far the best zombies out of World at War and Black Ops. There is the classic Nuke town as well as proper zombie story line and different maps which require different things to complete as well as fighting different types of zombies. Travel on a bus set up teleporters you name it the zombies is amazing but i find it rather difficult to solo so it's best to play with friends. The only true down side to this game is that it's pricey 9/10

AFTER HAVING 100+ HOURS IN GAME I BRING TO YOU,
20 THINGS YOU LEARN WHEN PLAYING BLACK OPS 2 ONLINE

4: prestige masters will master any game there are in

5: prestige masters LOVE to use a diamond SCAR H with stock supressor and quickdraw

6: prestige masters will always track you down you can not outrun them

7: prestige masters will always kill you even if you run behind a wall

8: people that will have god like aim and recoil control that is so good i cant put it into words

9: people that will go 65-2 in a Team Deathmatch (these kind usually mix with number 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8 and 15)

10: people that will go on 30+ kill streaks by using only a knife (these kind usually mix with number 2, 12 and 14)

11: people that will outgun you with a knife

15: people that will have mastered that art of C4 and grenade placement

reviewText:
When you buy this game, the game comes in 3 separate downloads. You download the single player, multiplayer, and zombies, and in all, it's around a 20-30Gb download (at least, it was for me.. Then again, DLC's). I played this a lot on my X-box, and then my X-box went into storage and one thing leads to another.. Ended up buying this on Steam.
SingleplayerThe storyline was always so much fun to play. Also, the ending. To die for. I won't say any more than that, just.. Trust me.
ZombiesIt's just like a regular zombie-shooter game. Not exactly as good as Killing Floor or something like that, but it's a zombie shooter. Just beware, if you play online, most of the kids in zombies are like 9-13 (Help).
MultiplayerRight. The only reason anyone buys Call of Duty games.. Well the community is still toxic as ever, so that's good. Not quite as bad as console, but still pretty bad. Less little kids, but they're still there.. Also, beware of people hacking, cause that's a thing now.
Yup.

Overall, just.. Good luck, and buy at your own risk.
