reviewText:
Alright, I'm gonna divide my reviews into four. I'll talk about the campaign, multiplayer, and zombies, and then I'll give my final thoughts.

-Campaign: Honestly it's boring, so I only played about ten minutes of it.

-Multiplayer: The multiplayer itself is a lot of fun, and I'm pretty damn good so owning noobs is always a good feeling. However, there are A LOT of damn kids playing this, so be ready to use that mute button because they are just everywhere.

-Zombies: Zombies just isn't the same anymore. It just doesn't have that same dark and gritty feeling that World at War had. I do like the map Town though; I think it's a well made map. Farm on the other hand is too damn small, and Tranzit is just confusing and doesn't make too much sense to me.

Final thoughts: The multiplayer is certainly worth playing, and zombies is fun with friends, but the campaign is boring. I rate this game 6/10.

reviewText:
T'is a good CoD game for the casual FPS-goer. SP is fairly interesting, though the unfortunate trend of introducing new gadgets only to use them once continues. The multiple endings is pretty cool and should be expanded in future installations.

MP is pretty balanced in that almost all of the guns are competent in one way or another and aren't completely outclassed by another (with some guns like the FAL, Remington 870 MCS etc.). Maps feature the signature three lane path. Not a huge fan of it, but haven't noticed anything particularly negative after getting used to the maps themselves. TAC/VAC helps keep the servers clean enough.

All in all, a decent, low skill ceiling shooter that anyone can grab and immediately enjoy. MP wise, compared to CoD4/MW2, I'll give this a 8.5/10. SP, 8/10.

reviewText:
Call of Duty: Black Ops II:Pros:
+Long and good story that comes as a sequel to the previous Black Ops title
+Multiple endings
+Equipment that you use on your mission is fully customizable

Cons:
No cons here!

Call of Duty: Black Ops II - Multiplayer:Pros:
+A lot of stuff to unlock
+Good maps
+11 Prestige (55 levels = 1 prestige)
+Awesome gamemodes
+Free skins (except for the customization packs but theyre only 2$ and some DLCs that add couple of maps)

Cons:
-VAC might be one of the best anti-cheat systems but on CoD it works like ♥♥♥♥ but if you get caught for hacking you will be autamticly placed in a lobby full of hackers xD
-Matchmaking system matches players randomly so you can be like level 1 and fight aginst people that are like level 55 or a higher prestige than you but for those who like a good challange this might be a good thing

Call of Duty: Black Ops II - Zombies:
Pros:
+Fun and addictive gameplay
+The only map that ins't DLC is awesome and has TranZit and Survival gamemode

Cons:
-Only 1 map isnt DLC

RATING: 10/10

reviewText:
This is an actual review and not a one sentence opinion, you're welcome.

I'll make this a quick one since unless you've been living under a rock or dont even play FPS games, you just want to know if this game is any good. So i'll get straight to the point. Yes, it's arguably the best COD game of this current generation. (Obviously not counting the superb classics COD4, Black Ops, & World At War) Unlike some of the stumbles the franchise has made over the last few servings, this game 'gets it right' in ways its successors should pay attention to. I'm going to split up the pros and cons between both the singleplayer and multiplayer so you can make the decision for yourself.

[SINGLEPLAYER]
The singleplayer is good. It isnt the most amazing thing ever, and the Treyarch AI hasnt changed much since BLOPS with enemies running straight at you like morons. The story has a few forks in the road to choose from, and the setpieces should keep you entertained for a single sitting. Basically, if you play COD for the story, its at least trying harder to be original than most of the Modern Day Gritty Warfare End of the World" sort of fare. So i give it credit for that. But just like every SP Campaign
date: it's much like watching an action movie. You watch it once
recommended: and thats about it. Its fun though
hoursPlayed:
dont get me wrong.

PROS
+ Varied & Interesting Environments
+ Entertaining Setpieces
+ Multiple choices within the story
+ Graphics are pretty good compared to other CODs

CONS
- Like most COD SP campaigns
voteText:
they're really only entertaining through one sitting
- Terrible & Predictable AI that runs straight at you most the time
- Voice acting sometimes isnt the best
- Story sometimes lacks consistency
- Editing and Scene Transitions are terrible


[MULTIPLAYER]
Alright
helpfulPercent: now for the multiplayer
votesHelpful: what everyone is really interested in anyway. The multiplayer is needless to say the best COD experience that uses the matchmaking system. It offers tons of customization for weapons great maps
votesTotal: and map-packs actually worth the money. The game is optimized good and runs well on most PCs able to handle it (Unlike Ghosts) and it has arguably the largest COD playerbase on steam due to these facts as well as a fantastic shortage of hackers compared to Modern Warfare 3. (Which is sometimes infested with them) Dont get me wrong
votesFunny: they're out there
commentsCount: but no game is truly 100% safe and Black Ops 2 does a great job handling them
column16: however they manage it. Now
column17: if you dont mind having to wait for a match in matchmaking lobbies
column18: i'd say this is easily the best bang for your buck
column19:
so lets get to the pros and cons already.

PROS
+ Fast frenetic & downright dumb fun (Like Modern Warfare 2)
+ Most maps are memorable and enjoyable (They even brought back Nuketown)
+ Map-Packs actually have good maps
+ Zombies is one of the best damn coop modes i've ever played
column20:
especially with friends
+ Tons of modes (Hooray for HC TDM anyone?)

CONS
- Uses matchmaking instead of dedicated servers (This ♥♥♥♥ seriously needs to stop)
- Weapons can be laughably overpowered
- Killstreaks are laughably overpowered (But i guess they are in every game)
- Not a game for campers
column21:
or slower players since most maps are CQB heavy
- No kind of user-generated content (But you obviously knew that already)

BOTTOM LINE
If you're fine with some of the best in silly unrealistic and hilariously fun Call of Duty gameplay minus the dedicated servers

reviewText:
I'm not a CoD franchise fan, not a little bit. But this one is good, simply to say, even though:

High price, useless DLCs, and outdated graphic engine sometimes makes me want to puke. But I must admit that the story is very worth it, yes, very good, 4 endings with surprising twist are things which keep me playing for hours.

Multiplayer? Don't ask me. Too laggy, long matchmaking duration, crashes,... . Well, but I don't complain, at least I really like Team Deathmatch mode.

8/10. Because I'm here for the story and memorial quotes.

PS: Cordis Die!
PS2: I won't buy Black Ops III, if any, ever.

reviewText:
This is an actual review and not a one sentence opinion, you're welcome.

I'll make this a quick one since unless you've been living under a rock or dont even play FPS games, you just want to know if this game is any good. So i'll get straight to the point. Yes, it's arguably the best COD game of this current generation. (Obviously not counting the superb classics COD4, Black Ops, & World At War) Unlike some of the stumbles the franchise has made over the last few servings, this game 'gets it right' in ways its successors should pay attention to. I'm going to split up the pros and cons between both the singleplayer and multiplayer so you can make the decision for yourself.

[SINGLEPLAYER]
The singleplayer is good. It isnt the most amazing thing ever, and the Treyarch AI hasnt changed much since BLOPS with enemies running straight at you like morons. The story has a few forks in the road to choose from, and the setpieces should keep you entertained for a single sitting. Basically, if you play COD for the story, its at least trying harder to be original than most of the Modern Day Gritty Warfare End of the World" sort of fare. So i give it credit for that. But just like every SP Campaign
date: it's much like watching an action movie. You watch it once
recommended: and thats about it. Its fun though
hoursPlayed:
dont get me wrong.

PROS
+ Varied & Interesting Environments
+ Entertaining Setpieces
+ Multiple choices within the story
+ Graphics are pretty good compared to other CODs

CONS
- Like most COD SP campaigns
voteText:
they're really only entertaining through one sitting
- Terrible & Predictable AI that runs straight at you most the time
- Voice acting sometimes isnt the best
- Story sometimes lacks consistency
- Editing and Scene Transitions are terrible


[MULTIPLAYER]
Alright

The game is optimized good and runs well on most PCs able to handle it (Unlike Ghosts) and it has arguably the largest COD playerbase on steam due to these facts as well as a fantastic shortage of hackers compared to Modern Warfare 3. (Which is sometimes infested with them) Dont get me wrong

reviewText:
One of the better cods, and one of the best fps games I've ever played.

CampaignThe black ops 1 campaign was very great, and the black ops 2 campaign followed it's footsteps. Black ops 2 has a really rich campaign, it's about a niqaraguian criminal that wants to control the world, he's kinda like hitler I guess. I'm not going to talk much about the campaign, just so I don't spoil it, but if you like the black ops 1 campaign, you are surely going to enjoy this as well.

ZombiesZielinski did a good job on zombies. Kinda. I'm one of those guys who just loves zombies in cod, zombies in this game are good and bad at the same time. If you get the dlcs you can enjoy a great amount of time playing trough all of the great maps, and trying to achieve high rounds. On the other side, if you don't have dlcs that you can only play Green run. Green run is a pretty big map here. Primarily, it is the map in which TranZit is a playable game mode that connects all the Survival maps and other areas consisting of the zombie maps set in Green Run into one large campaign" mode

reviewText:
Skor: 7,5/10
Grafik:Yaaa sama aja kaya shooter biasa yang lo temuin. Game ini termasuk medium buat gue. Selama lo punya processor i3, 4gb ram, 1 gb vga, lo bisa smooth di 50-60fps med. Bakalan drop ke 30 kalau high dan lagi penuh layar lo.

Gameplay:Single player : Semi modern. Kalau lo main game ini diatas tahun 2014, lo bakalan merasa BlackOps2 masih kalah jauh dengan Ghost Recon Phantom dari segi teknologi.

Multiplayer : Pertama kali lo main, lo adalah karakter level 1. Lawan lo siapa? karakter level 50. Serius. Gue main dari level 1 sampai 15 selalu 1 match dengan level 50. Bayangin aja, senjata gue SMG doang dan 2 granade melawan karakter level 50 dengan senjata... apaan tau kaya tai.. Bukan masalah skill... Semakin tinggi level lo, semakin keren juga inventory lo. lo kill 1, mati 8 Begitu terus... Cmon man, kenapa pula gue bisa ada satu match dengan level 50? emangnya susah yang matchmaking dengan level yang setara. 4 jam gue main, uninstall.

Story:So much plot twist. Bagus... kalau lo suka dengan konspirasi, pengkhianatan, terorisme, teknologi, dan peperangan, gue rekomendasikan bermain single playernya sampai tamat. Cerita yang ada di BO2 bener-bener mantab. Lo bakalan berada didua timeline yang berbeda: Alex Mason dengan setting di tahun 1960an dan anak dari Alex Mason yaitu David dengan setting ditahun 2025. Lo bakalan bolak balik dari 1960 dan 2025 sampai akhirnya kedua setting ini menjadi satu titik temu: Raul Menendez. Yup, dia adalah musuh bebuyutan lo dan ayah lo. Tugas lo adalah menyeselaikan apa yang ayah lo belum selesaikan.

KesimpulanBeli kalau harganya dibawah 100ribuan. Single playernya lumayan seru. Multiplayernya secara garis besar itu seru... ada semacam sistem level up yang membuat lo secara otomatis termotivasi untuk bermain. Sayangnya matchmaking nya yang buruk. Sabar banget deh lo dibunuh 10 kali sama level 50.
voteText: 7 of 12 people (58%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Really really good game.

I will try to go through everything in this review.

PRICE
OK, this is one of those things that make this game not so awesome. It still costs 60 euros, which is a bit too much for a almost-three-years-old game. C'mon, the price should be ~40 euros. Even watch dogs got cheaper. I know watch dogs isn't the game most loved by community, but it was made recently.

GRAPHICS
Graphics are good, and even everything on lowest / off  looks good.

CAMPAIGN
Campain is awesome. The story is just so cool. Replay value is included. Would buy this game even if it included campaign only.

MULTIPLAYER
There are still peepz who play this, and you will never ever find yourself not being able to find a TDM match. Ranking is good, and scorestreaks are really something special. Connection will not be your problem, unless you live on Mars.

ZOMBIES
The first moment when I tried zombies, I was like WTF is this?". But then
date:
I played it for some time and realised it was good.

OVERALL RATE
420/69 -IGN"

reviewText:
this is alot better experience to play than Ghost's as atleast this actually has stable FPS.,..... Anyways heres the reviews,This game has a very good action packed campaign mode  which is not as popular as MP as for some odd reaspn cod gamers are into mp only but im not like that and will give my verdict on all aspects of the game

Singleplayer: SP is action packed full of explosions very good well developed cutscenes and AAA gunplay and a very decent story,thats all i can really say about the SP  i give it a 7.5/10 due to its linear and scripted lvl designs in some missions, and its  very good well developed cutscenes and AAA gunplay and its story

Multiplayer: The multiplayer for this game is the undisputed powerhouse for the game it features many guns,perks,Killstreaks and fun gameplay  the feeling as a gamer of levelling up and acheiving something is greatly accomplishable in this game thats what makes it so good:it keeps players wanting more and more . the game runs amazingly on my setup which will be included below ,and is overall a great component of this game 9/10

Zombies mode: A fun co operative  gamemode grab some friends and see how long you survive.this gamemode whilst being good it just does not give me the same driving force as what the Multiplayer component of this game does for that reason i give it a 7.5/10 The zombies mode has limited maps aswell which may contribute to decreased playabilty. You may find your self needing more and actually finidng out your gonna have to pay to get more.the money you would have spent on maps could go to  a more survival/ wave battles focused game such as Killing floor which i belive to be far more worth spending the money on.
Thankyou for reading my review

reviewText: Honestly, the singleplayer is fun, if that's all you want then by all means go ahead and buy it. However, where this game falls short is the multiplayer. People give Ghosts crap for the multiplayer, but I'll be honest I actually have fun with that one. Can't say the same with this game. My sum up of the mutliplayer is this for newer players into the game: Get spawnkilled by thousands of overpowered killstreaks that are practically constant after 2 minutes into the match, killed by some ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ with a gold gun camping in the window (mostly scars), and getting shot in the back after moving two steps forward. I can't even make it through a whole multiplayer match without being bothered to the point of leaving. It's in no way shape or form balanced. That being said, I know Ghosts has some optimization problems, and the population could be higher, but multiplayer wise it's superior in my opinion. This game does have the better singleplayer though, however, that's not long enough to be worth paying full price for this. Buy it for the singleplayer if it's on sale, but otherwise I would say avoid this game like the plague.

reviewText:
Great game, a lot of bad commentary in the beginning i heard, definitely worth buying, but i 'd wait for a steam sale!
Zombies are great, multiplayer is great (no FMG9's like in mw3 or something bad like it), only downside i could find is the campaign being quite short (i ll explain later). The game itself is worth buying !!.

About Multiplayer:
It's balanced as it gets with these games, you ll always find a particular gun being better then another one. but not with major differences. The community online is nice (as far as it gets with fps games). The maps are somewhat small and short in numbers but buying the Revolution DLC remedies that with +4 maps ++1 zombie map + 1 NEW GUN (PEACEKEEPER) A GREAT GUN ! but requires playing a little bit tactically. ALTHOUGH THEY SHOULD HAVE ADDES A GAME MODE LIKE INFECTED IN MY OPINION.

About Zombies:
Well.... just great no downsides , it would have been amazing if they 'd add kino der toten though (which is sadly not the case).

About Campaign:
It's a nice story altough I don't really like it that every character is using cheap language so OFTEN. I mean every now and then like Capt Price in the MW series is GREAT and I had connection with that guy somehow, but I didnt had that connection with any character in this game. the bad language is a little bit overkill. I mean I actually had some raw feelings when sandman, grinch and truck died in mw3 at the 'down the rabbithole'mission. But I really didn't had that in this game.

Further: the story seems to be never reaching that special point where as you might think: hey let's do this campaign again. until you get to the mission where the bad guy is imprisoned and from that point it gets really good. but I think its sad this game advertised with drones taking over, which made customers think hey the game is about drones taking over, but very sadly this take-over-thing only lasted for about 2 missions. So the campaign gets nice really slow (this is bad, personally I 'd liek to be dropped in the middle of the action, like in MW3) and then it reaches it's peak at a very strange point in the story, and then that peak is gone in a flash and everything gets really boring again.

That's it really for my review. I think they could have made it better if the player could spend more time with like woods alone and have some good talk. but instead woods plays some bad-♥♥♥ vietnam-veteran and doesn't want to talk but only curse every single human on the planet, which is the downside on his character and which is also why I couldn't really find myself in this character ( to get this personal bond) same goes with harper, I chose to let him die and let farid live. I had more flow with farid rather than with harper which is weird because Harper is in about every mission, and Farid in just 3.

Improvements
I think possible improvements with a good testteam would be:
- Less cursing and calling names in the campaign
- larger maps in the multiplayer
- removing 80% of the lava in zombies
- removing 30% obstacles in zombies (it's just anoying)
- less recoil for the peacekeeper smg or making it a 3 shot kill instead of 4, I think a gun which    requires a DLC to be bought should at least be on par with the best gun in the default game or very close to it.
- it would have been cool if they added the browning hi-power / m11911 to the multiplayer ( cool old school stuff)
- the an-94 and the scar are slightly better than the other guns and very popular, i think the scar should be a 20 round mag weapon like in mw2 and the an94 should receive more recoil.
- the scorestreaks take a long time to get i think they should be set at -50 points. example: Hellstorm missile is 700 points, in my opinion it shouild be 650. just al ittle easier to get.
- groundwar should have a build-in function that score streaks are obtainable at 2x rate. because none really gets scorestreaks in groundwar like ever. only those 10-year old noobs who cheat/hack or play too much.
- snipers should be nerfed : ADS time should take longer, and snipers should only be able to shoot accuratly when aimed in completely to get quickscoping out of the picture.
- LMG's should have mroe damage output, equiping these things is making you slow anyway so there s gotta be something good on the otherside instead of only a larger clip of ammo.

What I think is good:
- its not only AR or SMG game play at least these two are now used variously.
- being able to extend your game via DLC's (although they overkilled the amount of DLC's here)
- quite good ballanced multiplayer,
- chat-option
- being able to mute everyone instead of just one player
- after prestiging the game holds your tokens to the guns you spent tokens on

Advise to Treyarch : don't make it taht obvious you want my money! 15 euro for 4 maps and an extra is a little too much.


SUMMERY
_________

-GREAT GAME
-GOOD MULTIPLAYER
-GOOD ZOMBIE SURVIVAL
-GOOD DLC's (advised: Revolution DLC)
-ABOUT 6-9k players @ multiplayer at the mid of the day
-MEH CAMPAIGN
-MEH CHARACTERS

I do recomment this game, but I 'd value it at about €35,- right now

Hope to see new players soon ;)

reviewText: Call of Duty: Black Ops II is certainly one of the franchise's more notable titles since Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare's massively critical & commericial success.\n\nI unfortunately cannot give an accurate review on the Multiplayer & Nazi-Zombie" co-op mode
date: as Call of Duty's multiplayer has ceased to be of any interest or enjoyment to me
recommended: nor do I have the company to provide me the optimal Nazi-Zombie experience. What I can say is this is one of the few respectable PC ports in the franchise
hoursPlayed: and it's single-player attempts some rather interesting new tricks to provide a new spice of life into the Call of Duty games.\n\nFirstly
voteText: the PC port.\nYou are given a wide number of options for Graphics & a particularly wide number of options for Audio. An especially welcome addition to these options an FOV Slider which provides a range from 65-90
helpfulPercent:
which also increases the viewmodel FOV with it.


Now
votesHelpful: the Single-Player (The favoured mode of play I know).\nTo sum up the story set-up
votesTotal: it's the third entry into Treyarch's story arch that began in Call of Duty: World at War
votesFunny: where you'll fight in two different time periods of the 1980s & 2025. I say anymore
commentsCount: I'd potentially spoil what little there is to find otherwise. What I will say is it does try to deliver a more detailed story whilst trying to add more development to it's characters
column16: especially it's antagonist. Whilst I personally wouldn't say Treyarch succeeded
column17: it was a step in the right direction
column18: which I hope more are made in the future.\n\nWhat makes it more interesting than it's predecessors is not only it's futuristic setting & RTS-like Strike Missions
column19: but also it's branching arcs. There are periods of the game where you can fail a mission or make a choice and it can alter the game's conclusion in up to 4 different endings. These are not always obvious to detect
column20: either making the experience more unpredictable or simply being replayability incentive for the player to replay the story to find a better outcome. I personally think the latter as the various endings would seem to rank from worst to best in certain regards. But it does allow for a more varying experience with the single-player.\n\nThe Strike Missions
column21: an all-new feature to Call of Duty: Black Ops II
column22: are optional missions in the single-player campaign. What's different about them is that they're a mixture of RTS & FPS gameplay
column23: allowing the player to command units such as a trooper squad
column24: ground & air combat drones & "CLAW" tankbots whilst being able to take manual control of each individual unit and continue to provide commands from the first person perspective.\nWhilst this was actually a very interesting mode to play
column25: the RTS side of things was somewhat unreliable
column26: especially during the more fast & tense moments
column27: with the AI sometimes a little difficult to tame or on occasions a little slow to respond to commands. I cannot recall if drones & "CLAWs" are limited in number or not
column28: but human soldier units seem to be unlimitedly replenishable
column29: which comes as a relief as they can be killed pretty quickly
column30: even if you've taken control of one of them and giving them a hand.\n\nAnd probably one of my favourite attributes that hasn't received much discussion is Single-Player Loadout Customisation. Each mission starts you with a recommended loadout of weapons & attachments
column33: as you progress through the campaign or complete various single-player challenges
column34: you can unlock the entire arsenal of weapons & attachments (3 can be used at once)
column37: perks & camoflague to customise your loadout before a mission/chapter
column38: providing a vast wealth of loadout variety & potential replay value. Although you're probably gonna want to stick to the "Access Kit" perk
column39: which will allow you to access secret doors
column41: etc for secrets or pickups which tip the gameplay in your favour. Another thing to note is that when unlocked
column42: you can take all of the Future Arsenal into the past missions
column43:
making for a little immersion-breaking fun (aswell as an achievement to encourage it).


So after that babble
column44: would I recommend it? If you enjoy Call of Duty
column45: then Yes I would. It's a good PC port & Treyarch applied a fair number of new ideas to provide improvement & breathe some new life into the franchise. Whilst they may not have all been significant enough or completely successful in my eyes
column46: they were a step in the right direction
column47: and with a franchise where any amount of change causes fright for developers & publisher and dedicated fans alike
column48: I can only give words of encouragement to Treyarch to try again!\nOtherwise
column49: there are a number of other shooter games I would consider to be more realised experiences such as Wolfenstein The New Order
column50: BioShock Infinite & Spec Ops: The Line."

reviewText:
I have played every single Call of Duty game ever published, and this is far the best that they could achieve.
The maps are very well designed (even if it misses the presence of a long-range map such as Crash or Crossfire), but it's impossible to just stand in a corner and wait for someone to pass through, there are always at least 3 ways to reach a determined point and you can easily dinstinguish players from background.
The guns are balanced and the Create-a-Class system is very nice: 5 classes (at 0prestige) with 10 slots, each gun or perk or attachment uses 1 slot, period.
The music is awesome, very entertaining even if it doesn't unfocus you from the game.
I could go more into detail, but i think that just this is a valid motivation to buy this game.

tl;dr: it's fast, it's balanced, it's well designed.

8/10

reviewText:
I have >1000 hours played on XBox 360 & ~150 on PC.

TLDR: Great game, multiplayer is above top notch, better than Ghosts. Hopfully CoD:AW is as good as this game.

As of June 29th, 2014, this is still the best CoD available. The guns are very balanced compared to other CoDs and the scorestreak rather than killstreak system is a major improvment and benifit to objective players. However the Pick-10-create-a-class-system" is by far the largest and best improvment from every other CoD. This revolutionized the customizability of classes you are able to create and the sheer power the player has to pick exactlly what they want is amazing
date: it is so well recieved that CoD:Ghosts (the CoD that was released after this game) basically copied it and impemented it into their own game
recommended: which I am glad as it is trully one the highlights of this game's multiplayer. Zombies is also quite fun and again a great improvement from the spec ops missions in MW3 (which were fun as well but not to the level of zombies). The emblem editor is also very apreciated

reviewText: Black Ops 2. Blops. BO2. Call it what you want, but I personally loved this game. The single player was interesting, very different from all the other CoD's. Zombies mode is fun to play, especially if you have friends to play with. Multiplayer is just like every other Call of Duty. It has its ups and downs. There's a wider variety of weapons and attachments. It has a lot of cool new features too, like the option to select your reticles. The maps are eh. If you have money to spend and like fast paced first person shooters, this is the game for you. However, I'm leaving the CoD series for Battlefield 4, and I honestly can't say I'm gonna regret it,

reviewText:
I've been playing Black Ops II multiplayer now since January 2013, so I'd like to say I've got a bit of experience under my belt. Most people purchase CoD for the Multiplayer so that is what I shall be reviewing here.

First the good stuff. Everything works. No one thing is more broken than another and most everything functions as you'd expect it to; which is flawlessly. The weapons feel solid, they're balanced and have their own unique traits but there is no real reason to use one weapon over another unless you're building classes for specific engagements/engagement ranges.
All the FPS mechanics you've come to expect from CoD are there and again, function flawlessly.

Now for the not so good stuff. Hit-reg can be a little hit and miss at times depending on your network quality and how bad your packet loss is; if I can make one suggestion it would be that you play on a good quality wired internet connection with large bandwidth. Wireless low speed connections are a big no-no in this game, more so than others, but less so than other FPS franchises such as Battlefield.
Now while CoD games are said to cater to the 'lone wolf' play style, there is one thing of note. You cannot and will not consistently win games if you do not have a party to play with (unless you are playing TDM and get your backpack on). Best played with friends but playable without.

Other things of note include:
Remington 870MCS=OP
Low playlist population
Matchmaking
No server browser
'Toxic' community (Not really, I've made a few friends on BO 2 so far)

To summarise; Black Ops 2 is a great game to play casually. Competitive isn't really a thing in CoD, if you want that go and play CoD 4 Promod or any of the Counter Strike games; you'll thank me later. But if you are looking for something to kill time (which it has done for me) and have been turned off by Infinity Ward's CoD Ghost; pick up Black Ops 2 when it's on sale.

Not quite worth the retail but still a good game.

Black Ops 2.

reviewText:
***I had this game for my 360 originally however I repurchased the game on PC when I got a gaming laptop***

Review:

To say this was one of the best CoDs is an understatement. It had a great single player campaign and really expanded from the original with multiple endings and memorable characters. Small choices were short term, however some were longlasting and affected the ending slightly to extremely different from the other; however after all this CoD put a good amount of attention on choice. On to the multiplayer side: One word: Extraordinary. For the PC, the game is extremely well optimized coming from a console port! It easily surpasses 60FPS on a descent gaming rig because it is not a demanding game by any means (even on a low rig these days your PC should easily handle the game over 40 FPS). Multiplayer is a blast and the pick 10 system laid the groundwork for last year's Advanced Warfare (which has a great experience too!) and optimized great too (unlike Call of Duty Ghosts but that's for another time). And last but not least, Zombies. Zombies in this iteration has been extended like never before from Treyarch's past games. Although the main characters were replaced by 4 new ones, they are still quite charming as the original 4; the originals even are playable in DLC 4's zombie map, origins. With new ways to fend off the undead hord, crafting tools, and various ways to survive, zombies is still as fun as it was in World at War and Black Ops. As it stands in June 2015, multiplayer is still extremely active, even with Call of Duty Advanced Warfare released, and is safe to say that population will return for a bit in the upcoming months leading to Black Ops III. Now on to final thoughts: While the game has an extreme amount of bang for your buck, for nearly a three year old game, It definitely felt like a breath of fresh air when it was released and stands out to this day from the yearly drag that Call of Duty has become in recent years, however at the end of the day, it is still Call of Duty and whether that is a good or bad thing is up to you. Iit is best to pick up this game on sale  for those hoping to jump in either to replay in preperation for Black Ops III, or if you are hoping to get warmed up come this November! Call of Duty Black Ops II remains as a great game to date and is fun across the single player campaign, multiplayer, and zombies. 4/5 stars

-PS: Be sure to get the season pass too!

reviewText:
Wonderfully optimized for PC. Fun to play. I also play this game on Xbox, and my opinion of it still holds true on a different platform: This is the best CoD since MW2, which many people say it was terrible, but terribly fun.

Couple of little things: The FoV at 90 can cause a few character model issues, like a head going inside another, but it's very rare, and only happened in single player. I also wish that there was a chat box in the lobby, similar to Titanfall. Besides that, I have nothing. Between this and, say Ghosts? No question. A lot people reviewing this game say to get BO2 over Ghosts, and I'm just going to reinforce that opinion.

If Advanced Warfare plays like BO2/Titanfall, I'll enjoy that as well, but only when it goes on sale. The only full price game I will ever purchase on PC will be Arkham Knight.

reviewText: Simply put, one of the best call of duty games i've ever played. Amazing continuation of the story which isn't exactly continuous from the first game as it picks up the story of Mason's son, set in the modern era. Yet it still beholds the Black ops feel from the first game along with the additions of some seriously cool stuff. And that's just the campaign, the multiplayer is fantastic for the lack of a better word. Well mapped maps and some wicked hell-yea" guns to select from.\n\nBut on to my favorite mode
date: Zombies!  The Zombies mode cannot be described by it's utter perfection. Drawing Guns on walls
recommended:
buying them. Upgrading you weapon from a low class to a powerful one. You can aqquire perks by drinking through specific machines; each with their own specific perk. What can be more fun then getting head shots on zombies?

8.2/10 Amazing. truly.

reviewText:
***I had this game for my 360 originally however I repurchased the game on PC when I got a gaming laptop***

Review:

To say this was one of the best CoDs is an understatement. It had a great single player campaign and really expanded from the original with multiple endings and memorable characters. Small choices were short term, however some were longlasting and affected the ending slightly to extremely different from the other; however after all this CoD put a good amount of attention on choice. On to the multiplayer side: One word: Extraordinary. For the PC, the game is extremely well optimized coming from a console port! It easily surpasses 60FPS on a descent gaming rig because it is not a demanding game by any means (even on a low rig these days your PC should easily handle the game over 40 FPS). Multiplayer is a blast and the pick 10 system laid the groundwork for last year's Advanced Warfare (which has a great experience too!) and optimized great too (unlike Call of Duty Ghosts but that's for another time). And last but not least, Zombies. Zombies in this iteration has been extended like never before from Treyarch's past games. Although the main characters were replaced by 4 new ones, they are still quite charming as the original 4; the originals even are playable in DLC 4's zombie map, origins. With new ways to fend off the undead hord, crafting tools, and various ways to survive, zombies is still as fun as it was in World at War and Black Ops. As it stands in June 2015, multiplayer is still extremely active, even with Call of Duty Advanced Warfare released, and is safe to say that population will return for a bit in the upcoming months leading to Black Ops III. Now on to final thoughts: While the game has an extreme amount of bang for your buck, for nearly a three year old game, It definitely felt like a breath of fresh air when it was released and stands out to this day from the yearly drag that Call of Duty has become in recent years, however at the end of the day, it is still Call of Duty and whether that is a good or bad thing is up to you. Iit is best to pick up this game on sale  for those hoping to jump in either to replay in preperation for Black Ops III, or if you are hoping to get warmed up come this November! Call of Duty Black Ops II remains as a great game to date and is fun across the single player campaign, multiplayer, and zombies. 4/5 stars

-PS: Be sure to get the season pass too!

I really like the Game, I enjoy it because it's fun, especually the campaign. Alot of people don't like the Campaign and just buy the Game for Multiplayer or zombies, so to be honest I would recommend you play the Campaign, you would enjoy it. Also, I like the further range of choice you can get, like the way you can choose what gun you can start with in the Campaign because I like it how some games can tailor around the way you play, but not like The Walking Dead, else it would spoil it.

Hopefully Treyarch doesn't go over the top with the Realism else it becomes un-realistic. But anyways, I love the Game and I would definitley recommend it to other poeple.

10/10 :)

reviewText:
Bestes Call of Duty bis jetzt (Stand: 5.7.2014)

pros:
+ niedrige Systemanforderungen
+ schnelles flüssiges Spielgefühl
+ 3 Modi: Zombies, Multiplayer, Singleplayer
+ gute Grafik
+ guter Sound
+ ausgeglichenes Spielerlebnis (Waffen und Perks)
+ 10 Punkte Klasseneditor (viele Möglichkeiten der Klassengestaltung, so wie man am liebtsen Spielen möchte/kann)

negativ:
- vermeintliche cheater bzw. viele übertrieben starke Gegner im Multiplayer (dass man denkt als ob sie cheaten würden)
- man stirb als noob viel zu schnell
- das Spiel erfordert viel Geduld, Nerven und können und bringt einen manchmal zum ausrasten
- zu viele 12 jährige, piepsstimmige Noobs im Multiplayer

wunderbares CoD von Treyarch ;) freue mich schon auf 2015 wenn das neue CoD wieder von Treyarch kommt ^^

reviewText:
hello

graphics 7.5- they still hold up well for their time, but some textures could have looked a lot better

gameplay 8.5 - very fun gunplay overall and like that at certain points you get to choose diffrent routes and you can approach certain cituatioin to your liking but overall it keeps in line with previous call of duty titles.

story 8.5 - what i like the most about the story is the fact that you have choice paths that can actually alter the ending of the game which adds replay value and its fun to see how things will play out depending on the route you take

sound 8 - the game has a great soundtrack overall but i would have like to see more varied sounds in the weaponds of the game but for the most part  you get great explosive sounds and good music to go with it.


anyway i played this originally on my ps3 and desided to replay the campaigne on pc and it is still one of the best call of duty games to date with a good story mode and plently of other modes to satify your thirst for shooting.

reviewText:
Call of Duty Black ops 2 Review
In my opinion call of duty black ops 2 is one of the best iteration of the entire COD franchise so far. I bought this games Digital Deluxe Edition a while back on a Steam sale and I do not regret it. it's no secret that Call of Duty is getting very very old and that it's being milked to death by Activision, but I'm glad that at least Treyarch can still bring some new interesting things to the table. this game is literally broken down into three separate parts. campaign, multiplayer and zombies and I'll go over each of them separately.

CAMPAIGN: Black Ops 2 campaign is by far one of the best Call of Duty campaign to date. it has one of the most epic and in depth stories of any of the CODs so far. most of the newer CODs (ghost and AW) have a absolutely ridiculous plot with an absolutely ridiculous amount of explosion and special effects that looks like it was directed by Michael Bay just to keep little 12 year old kids amused. Black Ops 2 actually takes time to explain itself and go in depth on its story and elaborates itself. there's also multiples choices throughout the campaign that leads to multiple endings giving you incentive to replay the campaign more than once. overall I found the campaign to be very enjoyable :)

MULTIPLAYER: the multiplayer in black ops 2 is pretty standard to all the other call of duties besides a few tweaks to the load out system and a new score streak system in place of the kill streak one and the return of the custom emblems from the originally Blacks ops. but overall it's still your standard Call of Duty multiplayer. so if you're not into Call of Duty multiplayer you're probably not going to like this one either but if you do like them then you should feel right at home with this one.

ZOMBIES: what can I say... zombies is the crown jewel of this game xD but personally I don't find this iteration of zombies as fun as black ops 1. transit is definitely an interesting mode and is very fun and difficult but it's no replacement to the traditional zombies we know and love. if you get the DLC I think you'll get more traditional zombie maps and that may fix it for you but i for one am not spending $40 on a bunch of DLC for a game that is nearly three years old... the closest map you get to a traditional zombies map in this game is town" and even that doesn't feel like a complete zombie experience :/ like I said I liked transit but I don't feel it's a replacement for traditional zombies. overall it was still fun though especially if you're playing with your friends.

so overall Black Ops 2 is still a very good game and is still a lot better than most call of dutys out now a days *cough cough* ghost *cough cough*... sorry i must be coming down with something xD lol anyway I would recommend this game to anyone that enjoys playing fast pace shooters
date: games with deep stories or just wants to relax and kill some zombies. either way you can't go wrong with this one ;)\n\nFinal Score: (8/10) Awesome :3"
hoursPlayed: true
